dismissalText.commentary: Hashim Amla run out (Mendis/Dickwella) 103 (115b 5x4 2x6 202m) SR: 89.56

dismissalComment.html: is this a big moment? Amla is run-out while trying to slide back in for the second. He tucked this to the man at the edge of the ring at midwicket. Kusal Mendis swooped in quickly and then fired a accurate throw on the bounce to Dickwella who smashed the stumps down to catch Amla at least a foot short. Tired end to a fabulous knock. Amla took a while to turn for the second and that cost him

dismissalText.commentary: Faf du Plessis c Chandimal b Pradeep 75 (70b 6x4 0x6 96m) SR: 107.14

dismissalComment.html: excellent catch by Chandimal at midwicket. This was short, he tried to flat-bat this into the midwicket boundary but the ball got slightly big on him and cramped him for room, so couldn't generate as much power as he would have liked. Chandimal dived low to his right held his composure to pull off a super catch.

headshotImage.caption: Q de Kock headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Q de Kock headshot

dismissalComment.html: beauty of a delivery to get a class batsman. Keeps at it - full and just around off stump - this one nips away slightly off the pitch, de Kock pushes feebly with minimal feet movement and gets a thick edge that has been pouched well by a diving Dickwella. Reward for persistence. Subdued knock from de Kock, didn't quite look a part today

dismissalText.commentary: Chris Morris run out (Tharanga) 20 (19b 3x4 0x6 30m) SR: 105.26

dismissalComment.html: sensational from Tharanga. One stump to aim at from mid-off, clean pick up and a rocket throw at the bowler's end. Morris, who hammered it straight to the fielder, had given up and was caught comfortably short.

dismissalText.commentary: Upul Tharanga c Miller b Imran Tahir 57 (69b 6x4 0x6 118m) SR: 82.6

dismissalComment.html: is that the game for South Africa? Tharanga has hit this straight to Miller at deep cover. He read the googly, got to the pitch of the ball to go over the infield. It was almost as if he forgot there was a man there. Miller was running in with the sun right in his eyeline but he did well to keep his balance

dismissalComment.html: the wrong'un has done the trick. Didn't look like Kapugeradara picked it. This one drifted back in a long way from wide of the crease, Kapu plays for the turning legbreak, stabs outside the line in an attempt to nurdle it to the legside and is struck plumb in front of middle. First-ball duck. Sri Lanka are sliding here

headshotImage.longCaption: Nuwan Pradeep player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: and that is that. Tahir finishes with four. A bit of flight, and Pradeep gives it the big yahoo. Connects pretty well, to be fair, but only manages to hit it as far as the man at long-on

headshotImage.caption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: taken! Mendis picked up one boundary with an uppish flick, but this time AB has stationed himself at a straight short midwicket. The ball, angling into the stumps and pitching on a good length, stopped on Mendis slightly, maybe, and AB jumps, times it just about perfectly, and plucks the ball out with an outstretched right hand. The ball was almost behind him when he caught it

headshotImage.caption: Seekkuge Prasanna player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Seekkuge Prasanna player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: this one snakes back in from length on off stump, Prasanna pushes outside the line and is comprehensively beaten. Hit above the knee roll, closer to the flap of the pad. Ball tracking shows the ball would've gone on to hit the top of middle and leg. Three reds, Sri Lanka sink further. Prasanna had taken a step across with his front foot as the bowler released, and ended up in a completely closed-off position

dismissalText.commentary: Dinesh Chandimal run out (de Villiers) 12 (21b 1x4 0x6 29m) SR: 57.14

dismissalComment.html: the celebration in the South African camp tells you why that is a big moment in the match. Chandimal struck this firmly but de Villiers anticipates the dive and moves swiftly to his right from extra cover to slide and half-stop. Then quickly recovers to run a few paces to pick up the ball and hit the stumps direct at the bowler's end to catch Chandimal at least a feet short. Stunning

commentPostTextItems.html: 6.35pm A big win for South Africa to kick off their campaign. Tomorrow, as we all know, we'll have a slightly lower-profile game between the two sides with the calmest sets of fans in the world. I know you'll join us for that, bright and early. Until then, goodbye!
For those with nowhere better to go... Why not head over to ESPNFC for the Champions League final, with kick-off approaching. UK users will get access to highlights, too.

Upul Tharanga: "At the start we bowled well, even after the Hashim-Faf partnership, we came back well. Keeping them under 300 was a good effort. We couldn't get any wicket in the middle period. We had Lakshan Sandakan - we could include him in the next game. We play against India next, we have to come back strongly, especially the batting - we have to get those big scores. Today I felt we played some loose shots."

AB de Villiers: It wasn't as true a wicket as the England-Bangladesh game. It was possible for them to chase it down, but we needed a few early wickets, which we got. It was important to assess in the first 10-15 overs. They bowled exceptionally well, and credit to our openers for seeing it out. It's scary, the amount of runs Hashim has piled on in his short career, hopefully many more to come." On bringing Tahir on late: "It was a difficult situation, it was just a feeling I got, there was no set plan. A little breeze, I had a little chat with him, and I just had a good feeling, when I brought him on." What's the biggest challenge as a captain: "Getting team selection right, and getting the balance right for every game."

Imran Tahir is the Player of the Match. "Been working really hard. Really enjoying. Hope it carries on through the tournament. I think [AB] knew the situation, I was always ready to bowl. The openers batted really well, but we stuck to our plans and came back strongly. I wasn't expecting any spin, watching the England-Bangladesh game the other day, but it helped my variations a little. Very happy with how it came out today. I've had a tough last one week, thanks for all the people who supported me."
AK Lakshminarasimhan: "Root, Williamson and today Amla, all the master batsman show their class in this champions trophy"
Bastian: "And once again, Hashim Amla isn't man of the match, despite his century."
AnilMartin: "So we've had three results in three games so far in CT... Chased, No Result and Defended."

6.23pm South Africa begin their tournament with a 96-run win. The result, and even the margin, may have been expected, given where the two sides stood before the match, but it wasn't as straightforward as that number might suggest. Sri Lanka bowled pretty well to keep South Africa down to 299, and their openers made a rollicking start and gave them a genuine shot at chasing it down. But the thing that South Africa had, and the thing Sri Lanka did not, was wicket-taking bowlers right through the attack. Imran Tahir has a sensational record against Sri Lanka, and he improved that further with figures of 4 for 27. A middle-order slump followed that opening partnership, and there was little Sri Lanka could do to recover.

commentTextItems.html: googly, pitching just short of a length well outside off. Surprised him but he coped well enough to defend into the off side

commentPreTextItems.html: Here's Tahir. He has two overs remaining. Slip in place.

Tushar: "Winning by a big margin of 100 runs would make this victory more sweet for the Saffas. With all the four teams in this group expected to give each other a tough fight, that second spot for the semifinals could well come down to who has a better run rate. Sri Lanka should try, even if remotely possible, to play out the remaining overs and reduce the victory margin."

dismissalText.commentary: Dinesh Chandimal run out (de Villiers) 12 (21b 1x4 0x6 29m) SR: 57.14

dismissalComment.html: the celebration in the South African camp tells you why that is a big moment in the match. Chandimal struck this firmly but de Villiers anticipates the dive and moves swiftly to his right from extra cover to slide and half-stop. Then quickly recovers to run a few paces to pick up the ball and hit the stumps direct at the bowler's end to catch Chandimal at least a feet short. Stunning
